snippet: Mitt Romney, Rick Santorum and Newt Gingrich are aligned with one of the most prominent groups fighting against same-sex marriage. They should make clear their disapproval.
abstract: Editorial holds that unsealed memos prove that the National Organization for Marriage is a blatantly political group that has used ruthless tactics in its fight against marriage equality, in clear violation of its status as a social welfare organization; observes that Republican presidential candidates Mitt Romney, Rick Santorum and Newt Gingrich are aligned with the group, and asserts that now that the group's poisonous political approach is out in the open, they should make clear their disapproval.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney, Rick Santorum and Newt Gingrich are aligned with one of the most prominent groups fighting against same-sex marriage. They should make clear their disapproval.
